workflow.name: Automated candidate screening & response using GPT-4, Mistral OCR and Slack notifications
workflow.description:
## üìä Description
Streamline your HR recruitment process with this intelligent automation that reads candidate emails and resumes, analyzes them using GPT-4, and automatically shortlists or rejects applicants based on skill and experience match. üì©ü§ñ
 The workflow updates your HR Google Sheet with detailed AI evaluations, notifies recruiters on Slack about high-scoring candidates, and sends personalized shortlist or rejection emails to applicants ‚Äî all in one seamless flow. üöÄ

## What This Template Does
1Ô∏è‚É£ Trigger ‚Äì Monitors the HR Gmail inbox for new job applications with attachments. üì¨
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Extracts Resume Data ‚Äì Uploads attached resumes to Mistral OCR to extract text for analysis. üìÑ
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Combines Inputs ‚Äì Merges candidate email data and resume content for complete context. üîó
 4Ô∏è‚É£ AI Evaluation ‚Äì GPT-4 analyzes the candidate‚Äôs qualifications against job requirements in a connected Google Sheet. üß†
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Scoring & Recommendation ‚Äì Generates a structured JSON output with job fit summary, skill match, AI score, and recommendation (Shortlist or Reject). üìä
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Record Update ‚Äì Logs AI evaluation results in a Google Sheet for centralized tracking. üìã
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Communication ‚Äì Sends professional shortlist or rejection emails to applicants via Gmail. üíå
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Team Alert ‚Äì Notifies HR on Slack when a high-scoring candidate is detected. üîî

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Saves hours of manual resume screening and sorting
 ‚úÖ Ensures consistent, unbiased candidate evaluation
 ‚úÖ Provides detailed AI-driven insights for every applicant
 ‚úÖ Automates communication and record-keeping
 ‚úÖ Improves HR productivity and response speed

## Features
Gmail trigger for new candidate emails
Resume text extraction via Mistral OCR API
GPT-4‚Äìpowered resume and email evaluation
Integration with Google Sheets for HR requirement mapping
Slack notifications for shortlisted candidates
Automated shortlist/rejection emails with custom templates
Structured AI output for analytics and reporting

## Requirements
Gmail OAuth2 credentials for inbox and email automation
Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials with edit access
OpenAI API key (GPT-4 or GPT-4o-mini)
Slack Bot token with chat:write permissions
Mistral AI OCR API key for resume text extraction

## Target Audience
- HR and recruitment teams managing large applicant volumes üßë‚Äçüíº
- Talent acquisition managers looking for AI-driven screening ü§ñ
- Organizations standardizing hiring communication üí¨
- Agencies building automated candidate evaluation systems üìà

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
1Ô∏è‚É£ Connect your Gmail account and configure the inbox trigger.
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Add Mistral API credentials for resume OCR extraction.
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Set up your Google Sheet with job role requirements and access credentials.
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Add OpenAI credentials (GPT-4 or GPT-4o-mini) for AI evaluation.
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Configure Slack credentials and HR channel ID for alerts.
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Test with a sample application to ensure correct data mapping.
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Activate the workflow to start automated recruitment processing. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: Automate Candidate Screening and Communication from Gmail to Google Sheets with GPT-4 and Slack

parameters.content:
## Resume Extraction
Fetches new candidate emails and checks for attachments.  
If a resume is attached, uploads it to Mistral OCR, retrieves a signed URL, extracts text, and stores it as structured resume data for the next steps.

## Communication & Logging 

Logs all candidate data, AI score, and decision to Google Sheets.  
Shortlisted candidates receive an email and Slack notification is sent to HR.  
Rejected candidates receive a professional rejection email automatically.

## Scoring & Routing 


Maps the AI‚Äôs structured results into consistent fields.  
Checks if the candidate should be shortlisted (Score ‚â•75 or recommendation = ‚ÄúShortlist‚Äù) and routes accordingly.

## AI Candidate Evaluation 


Sends the combined candidate data to GPT-4 for evaluation.  
The AI compares profile skills and experience against the HR requirement sheet, generates a fit summary, score, and recommendation.  
Output is parsed into structured JSON.

## Email Parsing & Merge 



Extracts sender details, subject, and message body from the candidate‚Äôs email.  
Merges the parsed data with the OCR-extracted resume text to create a single structured input for AI screening.

parameters.subject: Update on Your Job Application

parameters.content:
## üìã AI-Powered Candidate Screening & Communication

### How it works
This workflow automatically screens new job applicants and handles communication with them.  
When a new email arrives in your recruitment inbox, it extracts resume data using OCR, merges it with the email content, and sends both to GPT-4.  
The AI evaluates the candidate‚Äôs experience, skills, and role fit by comparing their profile against job requirements in your Google Sheet.  
Based on the analysis, it assigns a score and a recommendation (Shortlist or Reject).  
If shortlisted, the candidate receives a personalized email and the HR team gets a Slack alert.  
All candidate evaluations are logged in Google Sheets for tracking and reporting.

### Setup steps
1. Connect Gmail, Google Sheets, OpenAI, Slack, and Mistral OCR credentials.  
2. Create a Google Sheet named **‚ÄúHR Requirement‚Äù** listing job roles, required skills, and minimum experience.  
3. Create another Sheet named **‚ÄúCandidate Screening Log‚Äù** for storing AI evaluations.  
4. Add environment variables for Sheet ID, Slack Channel ID, and Gmail Label if applicable.  
5. Customize the email templates (shortlist/rejection) with your company info.  
6. Test with one applicant email before enabling auto-run.  
7. Schedule the Gmail trigger to check inbox every 5‚Äì10 minutes.

parameters.text:
={{ 
  "Candidate Email Metadata:
" +
  "Sender Name: " + $json["Senders Name"] + "
" +
  "Sender Email: " + $json["Senders Email"] + "
" +
  "Subject: " + $json["Subject"] + "

" +
  "Email Content:
" + $json["Email Content"] + "

" +
  "Resume Text:
" + $json["Resume Details"]
}}

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI-powered HR Recruitment Screening Assistant integrated within n8n.

Your role is to evaluate job applicants based on both their resume data and their email message. You assess how well a candidate fits open positions listed in the connected Google Sheet ‚ÄúHR Requirement‚Äù.

Each record in that sheet includes:
- Role
- Minimum Experience (in years)
- Preferred Skills
- Department
- Key Traits
- Job Summary

---

### üîπ INPUT YOU RECEIVE
You will always receive:
- Candidate Email Metadata (sender name, sender email, subject, and email content)
- Candidate Resume Text (OCR-extracted or text version)
- Context about HR requirement data via the connected Google Sheets tool

---

### üîπ YOUR TASK
Analyze the **resume** and **email message** together to determine:
1. Candidate‚Äôs name and contact info (use the resume or email)
2. Role applied for (explicitly mentioned or inferred from email subject or content)
3. Total professional experience (in years)
4. Matched skills vs. missing skills (compare against HR sheet for that role)
5. A concise job fit summary
6. AI Score (0‚Äì100)
7. Recommendation (‚ÄúShortlist‚Äù or ‚ÄúReject‚Äù)
8. One-line reason for the recommendation

---

### üîπ EVALUATION LOGIC
1. Identify the target job role ‚Üí from the email subject or resume. If not clear, mark `"role_applied": "Unknown"`.
2. Query the HR Requirement Sheet for that role and use it to determine the expected skills and experience.
3. Extract the candidate‚Äôs professional experience, education, and technical skills from the resume text.
4. Compare and calculate a match percentage:
   - Match ‚â•70% ‚Üí `"recommendation": "Shortlist"`
   - Otherwise ‚Üí `"recommendation": "Reject"`
5. Assign `ai_score` as the overall fit (0‚Äì100).
6. Write a clear, short factual explanation in `reason`.
7. Always return **only valid JSON** in the required format (no text outside the JSON).

---

### üîπ OUTPUT JSON SCHEMA
```json
{
  "candidate_name": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "role_applied": "string",
  "total_experience": number,
  "matched_skills": ["string"],
  "missing_skills": ["string"],
  "job_fit_summary": "string",
  "ai_score": number,
  "recommendation": "Shortlist or Reject",
  "reason": "string"
}

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
